title: Seattle is so quiet, I'll miss this after the Pandemic is over. Do we have a noise pollution problem?
text:
It's a rough time for everyone, and I realize it's because of the lockdown, but we live right downtown near Pike and Boren, and we're just blown away by how quiet it is now during the stay-at-home order. 

We've always hated the noise, although we love living downtown so we tolerate it. But it's gotten a lot worse in the last 25 years, and it seems like we have a serious noise pollution problem in Seattle. The pandemic has really made it obvious. 

What can we do to keep the noise down in the future?
